page.title: 02LOCAL NEWS WEEK FROM 17/6/85
page.content: This is a report from our visit to Hereward Radio the town's ILR station:- P.C.Buxton school liason officer has recently retired and he has been given cheque for Â£170,money raised by some local school children.He has been with the force for 26 years.**For the first time in its long history the annual Carnival will take place on a Sunday instead of Thursday,a record turn-out is expected.There will be 160 floats and the Hereward Radio car will be joining the procession together with Miss Hereward Radio and several Station personalities.**The pedestrianisation of Abington Street is proceeding as planned however this week customers of Oliver Adams were complaining that their sandwiches,rolls and loaves tasted of tar due to the roadworks near their shop.This work is expected to be completed ready for Christmas shoppers
